column4: Does anybody have experience with firestarter.... I just installed it. But it complains about eth0 not wel configured
is eth0 your only active network card?
yes, but I also have eht1
when I hit the start buttun it says (dutch) that eth0 is not ready...
are both of your eth setup properly in /etc/network/interfaces ?
looks like that file is ok
you can configure your network cards using the graphical interface under System -> Administration -> Netowrking
or you can manually add your interfaces to /etc/network/interfaces
did you follow the Firestarter wizard and assign the correct eth device for external and internal network?
my guess is that only one of your interfaces is configured properly. are you trying to share internet ??
ok the problem is with internet sharing
open your /etc/network/interfaces and copy the lines that are for eth0 for eth1
then run the Firestarter wizard again
iface eth1 inet dhcp
try /etc/init.d/network restart
oops
/etc/init.d/networking restart .. ignore the first one
it is still complaining about eth0 in Firestarter and on the command line about eth1?
it was only one line I needed to copy in that file?
that's really odd.. I have never setup ICS through firestarter. I have always manually configured that so I'm not sure what the firestarted wizard does/expects
I do suggest you try configuring eth1 through the graphical tool I told you about
in your case eth0 was the device... if you go through the gui you'll see that eth1 is not configured.. I suggest you configure eth1 by assigning a static ip addres to it such as 192.168.0.1
